intro: Hieracium pilosella subsp. stenophyllophorum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and woodland edges, preferring well-drained soils. The plant features basal and stem leaves that are narrow and lance-shaped, with hairy surfaces. Its flowering stems bear yellow composite flowers, consisting of many small florets arranged in a disk. It is characterized by its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions, making it a common sight in temperate regions.
